item.title: Dumped sofa on roadside, 9th August
item.description:
Please can this dumped sofa and rubble next to it be removed asap.

item.title: Area around bus stop full of litter, 9th August
item.description:
Grass verges around the bus stop full of litter. Litter all along Rochester way. The area is dirty and badly cared for

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes created by the resurfacing of the road, 9th August
item.description:
The roundabout at the Chinese Roundabout was resurfaced 5 Aug to 8 Aug. However when resurfacing the road they simply could be bothered to fill in the area between the curb stones and manhole covers in the road which basically mean they created left two "potholes" in the road. In addition they resurfaced the road much higher than manhole covers thereby creating two sunken manhole covers which is basically like driving over potholes. As the road have been narrowed to create cycle lanes is is not possible to avoid these newly holes/ ditches/uneven road surface. I simply cannot believe this extremely shoddy and totally unacceptable "resurfacing" job has been signed off and accepted by the relevant authority. Clearly nobody can be bothered to ensure that these roadworks are completed to an acceptable standard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Wickham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on street, 9th August
item.description:
Please ensure cleaners are patrolling routinely. that seems to be more litter than before left on streets

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-21, Finchley Road, St. John's Wood, London

item.title: Over hanging bushes in narrow close. Weeding hasn’t been done for several weeks/months., 9th August
item.description:
The bushes are overgrown and the beds haven’t been weeded. This is council property. The bin lorries often knock off over hanging branches from the tress. This need pruning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baytree Close, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree about to die if not taken care of, 9th August
item.description:
The tree planted between 105 and 107 Brooke Road looks very poorly. It is surrounded by overgrown plants, some taller than 1 meter, competing with it. It would be less costly to take care of it now than have to remove it and replant another one later.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Guilford Street, Holborn, London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: The overhang from Murray Business Centre, 9th August
item.description:
I live next to Murray business centre, (rear of Lidl), The overhang into my garden is about five feet, I have had it cut down at cost in the past, I cannot keep up with it, the debris falls on my washing and constantly needs cleaning up. Please can it be cut back? I am a pensioner and on oxygen and clearing up after it is too much and having to rewash some clothes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 162, Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on tree planter - Queens rd Peckham - Meeting House Lane, 9th August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 175, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London
